who has led Google for a decade, will become executive chairman focusing on external relations, deals and government relations.New Yorker writer Ken Auletta , who has written a book on the company, reported Friday that Eric Schmidt had been nudged aside. " Ken Auletta said that after losing out to Page and co-founder Sergey Brin over the company's China policy a year ago, " Eric Schmidt lost some energy and focus. " Eric Schmidt was also criticized for allowing Google to be overtaKen Auletta by Facebook, for the company's increasingly frequent privacy scandals and its increasing internal bureaucracy. Together with the co- founders, he decided to step aside.In announcing the move Thursday, Eric Schmidt said that the company no longer needed his "adult supervision and that Page, 38, was ready to run the world's leading internet company. the company needed a more mature leader. Eric Schmidt , 55, will remain an adviser to Larry Page and Google's other co-founder, Sergey Brin , as Google's executive chairman. The changes will be effective April 4. In my clear opinion, Larry Page is ready to lead and I'm excited about working with both him and Sergey Brin for a long time to come, Eric Schmidt said. Larry Page praised Eric Schmidt , too. "There is no other CEO in the world that could have kept such headstrong founders so deeply involved and still run the business so brilliantly," Larry Page said.
